intro: Donella lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf donella, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Donella lanceolata is often found in rich, loamy soils and is a valuable component of native plant communities.
